Author: coinmonks || CoinCodeCap#8469
Content:
I am trying to understand Komodo's atomic swap .. I have few questions 

1- 0.15% fee for commiting against an order.. How you decided it should be 0.15%  and this fee will be paid in which token? 

2- In the example where, it's detailing process of BTC <--> KMD swap .. It's saying if Bob want to swap 100 BTC against KMD , it needs to deposit 112 BTC first.. Then again send 100 BTC for swap ..am I understanding this correctly?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: that has been changed

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: only the taker pays 0.15% in the coin they are trading

Author: coinmonks || CoinCodeCap#8469
Content: So extra deposit has been removed ..correct ?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: correct

Author: coinmonks || CoinCodeCap#8469
Content: do this atomic swap can support BTC<--> ETH too?

Author: coinmonks || CoinCodeCap#8469
Content: on KMD blockchain

Author: bartwr#6773
Content: The mm1 supported 'etomic' (ETH/ERC20) swaps. mm2 will support this in the future, I expect. Any chain that can support locking of funds as well as multisig can be supported. ETH/BTC as well, via a smart contract deployed on ETH having these 2 features

Author: coinmonks || CoinCodeCap#8469
Content: what is mm

Author: gcharang#6833
bartwr#6773
Content: mm = marketmaker, the name of the software that implements the BarterDEX protocol for doing atomic swaps.

Author: coinmonks || CoinCodeCap#8469
Content: I want to understand..how this atomic swap working technically ..any good resource?

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PeavTHz8LSA&t=5s
old version
but the new version is similar and less steps

Author: coinmonks || CoinCodeCap#8469
Content: Cool

Author: bartwr#6773
Content: The video above. And also the white paper does give good information. Recently in moving from mm1 to mm2 there have been some changes in the protocol. But in general the white paper explains it well.

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
@bartwr mm2 doesn't need etomic
now ETH swaps are direct too

Author: bartwr#6773
Content: @gcharang Ah, cool. That I didn't know. Thanks :)

Author: bartwr#6773
Content: White paper from 2017: https://github.com/KomodoPlatform/KomodoPlatform/wiki/barterDEX-Whitepaper-v2

Author: bartwr#6773
Content: Here's a video explanation as well: https://www.blockbar.nl/bdex-on-rpi/ (I co-organized the workshop)

Author: coinmonks || CoinCodeCap#8469
Content:
Ok.. Now in that video.. deposit not need... 

So process looks like this 

Bob want to swap 1 btc against eth with Alice  

Now I go to barterDex.. create an order with 1 BTC 

Alice see the order pays .015% fee and deposit the ETH on  a secure address (what is this secure address, who is controlling it)

Then Bob send his BTC on a secure address (What is this secure address and who is controlling it)

Now swap happens (Who is signalling this swap, checking if funds a re deposited and settling trade  )

Author: Kay Gee#2313
Content: Hello all, I received the dust in my new account on 12 june but I have not yet received the funds

Author: Kay Gee#2313
Content: I was expecting the funds to arrive on 13 June

Author: Kay Gee#2313
Content: Can anybody please confirm the status?

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
@coinmonks || CoinCodeCap it is called an address for the sake of simplicity, its actually a p2sh (pay to script hash)
this p2sh can be unlocked with a secret by Alice or it will go back to bob after a specific time

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
Alice also locks her coins with the same secret bob has already done

when bob claims alices coins, he is exposing the secret thereby allowing alice to claim bob's coins

Author: SHossain#0007
Content:
**Affected Devices**
YubiKey FIPS Series with firmware 4.4.2 and 4.4.4 ‚Äì there is no released firmware version 4.4.3.

YubiKey FIPS
YubiKey Nano FIPS
YubiKey C FIPS
YubiKey C Nano FIPS

**Not Affected Devices**
All other Yubico products are not affected by the issue detailed in this document.
